alert.note: Alert for Marin; Napa; San Francisco; Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 15 at 9:21PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, Marin, Napa, San Francisco and Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 920 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain producing one-quarter to one-half inch of rainfall per hour. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Napa, Petaluma, San Rafael, Novato, American Canyon, Mill Valley, San Anselmo, Larkspur, Sonoma, Corte Madera, Tiburon, Fairfax, Sausalito, Black Point-Green Point, Boyes Hot Springs, Lucas Valley-Marinwood, Kentfield, San Geronimo, Strawberry and Tamalpais-Homestead. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
